Hm, HTML is the authoritative definition of :state(), yeah? It's not just referencing another spec, right? (MDN links to HTML for it, at least.)
(I ask because its definition isn't marked up correctly to be picked up for auto linking, and I'm making sure it's the right place before I drop a PR.)
TabAtkins: yes. Though I think for completeness there also needs to be a definition in Selectors for parsing purposes.
content.formatted_body: TabAtkins: yes. Though I think for completeness there also needs to be a definition in Selectors for parsing purposes.

content.body: Ah, ok, I'm happy to drop the canonical definition into Selectors, then.
TabAtkins: https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/#selector-custom is the current definition; I don't remember exactly why it doesn't have :state() in its name
content.formatted_body: TabAtkins: https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/#selector-custom is the current definition; I don't remember exactly why it doesn't have :state() in its name

content.body: yeah, the name is wrong *and* it's not exported (like the other terms, which is correct for them since they're just internal dfns and should be deferring to the dfns in other specs)
content.formatted_body: yeah, the name is wrong and it's not exported (like the other terms, which is correct for them since they're just internal dfns and should be deferring to the dfns in other specs)

content.body: I thought we settled this with a for="" at some point...
I'm not sure what a for='' would do here.
No I guess we settled on noexport
https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/8467 is the PR, but it's hard finding the relevant thread among all the resolved threads.
